member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.param: A 3 length array that contains the component values.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.ToRGB
member.summary: Converts DAC values [0..63] to RGB range [0..255].
member.returns: Returns new value in RGB range [0..255]. In most of the cases, this value is an aproximation to the real RGB value.
member.remarks: DIV Games Studio and other software that works in old VESA modes, using the DAC format for colors instead of full RGB format. Use this function to adapt DAC values to RGB in order to work properly with modern implementations.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.ToDAC
member.summary: Converts RGB values [0..255] to DAC range [0..63].
member.returns: Returns new value in DAC range [0..63]. In most of the cases, this value is an aproximation to the real DAC value.
member.remarks: DIV Games Studio and other software that works in old VESA modes, using the DAC format for colors instead of full RGB format. Use this function to adapt RGB values to DAC in order to work properly with DIV Games Studio.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.Normalize(DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorFormat)
member.param: Indicates the color range for set the normalization factor.
member.returns: Returns a with the components normalized.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.IsDAC
member.summary: Is a valid DAC color value?
member.returns: Returns if the RGB components are into the DAC range values [0..63].

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.
member.param: The object to compare with the current instance.
member.returns: if and this instance are the same type and represent the same value; otherwise, .

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.GetHashCode
member.summary: Generates a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: Returns an value composed by the RGB values for the first 3 bytes and a zero for fourth byte.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Color.ToString
member.summary: Serializes the relevant data of this instance in a value.
member.returns: Returns a value with the relevant serialized data in JSON format.

member.summary: Gets the array from this instance.
member.returns: Returns new array of DAC values [0..63].
member.remarks: Use the function get a full RGB range [0..255] array.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.ColorPalette.Sort
member.remarks: This method try to sort the colors using the Nearest Neighbour algorithm, trying to ensure that the black color (0, 0, 0), if exists in palette, be the first color. This implementation is based on this article: https://www.alanzucconi.com/2015/09/30/colour-sorting/

member.summary: Generates a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: Returns an SHA256 hash code from the MD5 hash created by the binary serialized data of this instance.

member.summary: Serializes the relevant data of this instance in a value.
member.returns: Returns a value with the relevant serialized data in JSON format.

member.name: T:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Converters.BMP256Converter
member.summary: Base converter for all supported image formats to BMP 256 colors.
member.remarks: This class is the core of the image conversions to DIV Games Studio formats like and files.

member.summary: Converts supported image format to a 256 colors BMP.
member.param: array that contais the image data to convert.
Gets the palette extracted from the converted image.
Gets the width of the image.
Gets the height of the image.
Gets the bitmap data of the converted image referencing the palette values.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.Converters.BMP256Converter.ConvertTo(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int16@,System.Int16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Converts supported image format to a 256 colors BMP using an existing color palette.
member.param: array that contais the image data to convert.
The palette that contains the colors that must be used in conversion process.
Gets the width of the image.
Gets the height of the image.
Gets the bitmap data of the converted image referencing the palette values.

member.summary: Creates new instance from a supported image file.
member.param: Indicates if is needed to sort colors of the imported palette. By default is .
member.returns: Returns a new instance.
member.remarks: Supported image formats are JPEG, PNG, BMP, GIF and TGA. Also supported 256 color PCX images, and files.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.PAL.ToRGB
member.summary: Creates a copy of the array converted to full RGB format [0..255].
member.returns: Returns a new array in full RGB format [0..255]. In most of the cases, these values are an aproximation to the real RGB value.

member.name: M:DIV2.Format.Exporter.PAL.Sort
member.remarks: This method try to sort the colors using the Nearest Neighbour algorithm, trying to ensure that the black color (0, 0, 0), if exists in palette, be the first color.
